name: Veterans Day Quiz | Holidays - General | 5 Questions

questions.text: What was Veterans Day first known as?
questions.explanation:
Armistice Day.

	It was officially established in 1926. The 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month.

questions.text: In what year did Eisenhower sign the bill proclaiming November 11th as Veterans Day?
Veterans Day was changed to the fourth Monday in October by law in 1968. When was it changed back to fall on the actual date?
questions.explanation:
1978.

	This was done with the signing of public law number 94-97.

questions.text: In what year was the body of an unknown American from the Vietnam War buried in the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier?
questions.explanation:
1984.

	In 1998, this veteran was identified through DNA tests and was disinterred and reburied by his family.

questions.text: In the total of all wars including the American Revolution, War of 1812, Indian Wars, Mexican War, Civil War, Spanish American,WW1,WW2, Korea, Vietnam and the Gulf War approximately how many Americans served?
questions.explanation:
42 Million.

	According to the Veterans Administration estimate 42,348,460.
